constructor.details: Constructor that disables initializers when the implementation contract is deployed. This prevents the implementation contract from being initialized, which is important for security since the implementation contract should never be used directly, only through delegatecall from the proxy.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

getRoleMembers(bytes32).details: Return all accounts that have `role` WARNING: This operation will copy the entire storage to memory, which can be quite expensive. This is designed to mostly be used by view accessors that are queried without any gas fees. Developers should keep in mind that this function has an unbounded cost, and using it as part of a state-changing function may render the function uncallable if the set grows to a point where copying to memory consumes too much gas to fit in a block.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

increaseVouch(uint256).custom:throws: {NotAuthorForVouch} If the caller is not the author of the vouch{AlreadyUnvouched} If the vouch has already been unvouched

params.vouchId: The ID of the vouch to increase

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setEntryDonationFeeBasisPoints(uint256).custom:throws: {FeesExceedMaximum} If new total fees would exceed maximum

setEntryProtocolFeeBasisPoints(uint256).custom:throws: {FeesExceedMaximum} If new total fees would exceed maximum

setEntryVouchersPoolFeeBasisPoints(uint2.custom:throws: {FeesExceedMaximum} If new total fees would exceed maximum

setExitFeeBasisPoints(uint256).custom:throws: {FeesExceedMaximum} If new total fees would exceed maximum

params.amount: New minimum vouch amount in wei.

params.authorProfileId: The profile ID whose vouches will be slashed
params.slashBasisPoints: The percentage to slash in basis points (100 = 1%)

returns._0: totalSlashed The total amount slashed across all vouches

targetExistsAndAllowedForId(uint256).details: Checks if target exists and is allowed to be used.

returns.allowed: Whether target is allowed to be used.

unvouchUnhealthy(uint256).details: Convenience function that combines unvouch and mark unhealthy to avoid multiple transactions.

updateMaximumVouches(uint256).details: Only callable by admin when contract is not paused

params.maximumVouches_: The new maximum number of vouches

params.owner: Owner address to be used instead of current.

updateUnhealthyResponsePeriod(uint256).details: Updates time period for unhealthy response.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

verifiedVouchByAuthorForSubjectAddress(u.details: Gets a verified vouch by author for subject address.

verifiedVouchByAuthorForSubjectProfileId.details: Gets a verified vouch by author for vouchee profile Id.

vouchExistsFor(uint256,uint256).details: Checks whether vouch exists for author and subject profile Id.

configuredMinimumVouchAmount().notice: Minimum amount that must be staked for a vouch in wei

entryDonationFeeBasisPoints().notice: Donation fee in basis points charged on entry

entryProtocolFeeBasisPoints().notice: Protocol fee in basis points (100 = 1%) charged on entry

entryVouchersPoolFeeBasisPoints().notice: Fee in basis points distributed to existing vouchers on entry

exitFeeBasisPoints().notice: Fee in basis points charged on exit/withdrawal

increaseVouch(uint256).notice: Increases the amount staked for an existing vouch

maximumVouches().notice: Maximum number of vouches allowed per profile

protocolFeeAddress().notice: Address where protocol fees are sent

rewards(uint256).notice: Maps profile IDs to their rewards balance in ETH

setEntryDonationFeeBasisPoints(uint256).notice: Updates the donation fee percentage charged on entry

setEntryProtocolFeeBasisPoints(uint256).notice: Updates the protocol fee percentage charged on entry

setEntryVouchersPoolFeeBasisPoints(uint2.notice: Updates the vouchers pool fee percentage charged on entry

setExitFeeBasisPoints(uint256).notice: Updates the exit fee percentage charged on withdrawals

setProtocolFeeAddress(address).notice: Updates the address where protocol fees are sent

slash(uint256,uint256).notice: Reduces all vouch balances for a given author by a percentage

unhealthyResponsePeriod().notice: Time period after unvouching during which a vouch can be marked unhealthy

updateMaximumVouches(uint256).notice: Updates the maximum number of vouches allowed

vouchCount().notice: Total number of vouches ever created

vouchIdByAuthorForSubjectProfileId(uint2.notice: Maps author profile IDs and subject profile IDs to their active vouch ID

vouchIdsByAuthor(uint256,uint256).notice: Maps author profile IDs to their list of vouch IDs

vouchIdsByAuthorIndex(uint256,uint256).notice: Maps author profile IDs and vouch IDs to their index in the vouchIdsByAuthor array

vouchIdsForSubjectProfileId(uint256,uint.notice: Maps subject profile IDs to the list of vouch IDs vouching for them

vouchIdsForSubjectProfileIdIndex(uint256.notice: Maps subject profile IDs and vouch IDs to their index in the vouchIdsForSubjectProfileId array

vouches(uint256).notice: Maps vouch IDs to their full vouch data
